intro: Tetramolopium procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically narrow, linear leaves. The plant is a low-growing perennial with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and desert scrub environments. Tetramolopium procumbens is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
